citation.article-title: Sporolactobacillus putidus sp. nov., an endosporeforming lactic acid bacterium isolated from spoiled orange juice
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sporolactobacillus putidus sp. nov.
Sporolactobacillus putidus (pu′ti.dus. L. masc. adj. putidus stinking).
Gram-positive, anaerobic, motile, endospore-forming straight rods with rounded ends (0.5–0.8×3.0–8.0 μm).
The endospores are oval and subterminal with swollen sporangia.
Colonies on plate count agar are circular and 1–2 mm in diameter after 72 h, and are not pigmented.
The temperature range is 30–45 °C (optimum growth temperature: 35 °C).
The optimum pH is 4.5–5.0; growth does not occur at pH 3.0 or 6.0.
Oxidase and catalase activities are negative.
Acid is produced from galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-tagatose.
The major fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The type strain is strain QC81-06T (=DSM 21265T=JCM 15325T), isolated from spoiled orange juice.
